alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey; Walworth (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 12:40PM MST until January 19 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM CST /2 AM MST/ THURSDAY TO 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Very cold wind chills. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Wind chills ranging from 25 below to 30 below zero Thursday night. * WHERE...Corson, Walworth and Dewey Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM CST /2 AM MST/ Thursday to 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
